intro: Cyphostemma congoense, commonly known as the Congo moonvine, is a climbing plant native to Central and Eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, waxy leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing along forest edges or in disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
